qas.question: Prior to 7th century, what was primary religion of Egypt?
What became the main source of law with increasing Islamic influence in Egypt?
Under what leader did Islam become official religion of Egypt?

context: Although Egypt was a majority <a0_0>Christian<a0_0/> country before the 7th Century, after Islam arrived, the country was slowly Islamified to become a majority Muslim country. Egypt emerged as a centre of politics and culture in the Muslim world. Under <a2_0>Anwar Sadat<a2_0/>, Islam became the official state religion and <a1_0>Sharia<a1_0/> the main source of law. It is estimated that 15 million Egyptians follow Native Sufi orders, with the Sufi leadership asserting that the numbers are much greater as many Egyptian Sufis are not officially registered with a Sufi order.
